author: henokp50
title: Crowdfunding Platform with ADA
description: 缺少为非洲初创企业筹集资金的众筹门户。

f6_assessments.q0: 首先，这个融资建议与挑战书中的 "主要电子商务供应商的AdaPay插件 "完全不一致，应该考虑在Fund7中进行杂项融资。  我也对这个提案试图解决的问题以及提出的解决方案有一些疑问。  它表明，非洲没有众筹，但整个非洲的众筹已经建立起来，并在2016年爆发后迅速增长，大多数主要参与者如Thundafund都有BTC支持的选项。  虽然ADA众筹平台将是Cardano/非洲社区的一个受欢迎的大使（就像它从......Project Catalyst中脱颖而出一样），这个提议几乎没有访问这个想法。  相反，前6个月的资金集中在完成现有的ADA/当地货币配对交换试点和社会媒体活动，以推动它的采用。  计划随后推出和测试一个众筹平台，估计将在资助开始后一年内交付其第一个资助项目，大多数KPI与基础交易所的成功有关。  这项建议确实为其众筹制定了一个雄心勃勃的目标。  在提案的第二年，有100个项目获得1亿美元的资金。  它表明未来会有更大的规模，特别是对交易所而言，因此可以假设众筹方面也会从这种增长中受益，尽管没有进一步提及。
f6_assessments.q1: 这个雄心勃勃的提案缺乏一些关键指标，而这些指标将大大增强对其执行的信心。  项目的范围与预算中的资金和拟议的资源，特别是工作人员没有关系。  很难想象，在用两个人的员工推动目标采用数字的同时，还能启动一个外汇交易所，开发和启动一个众筹创业孵化器。  此外，对于开发和营销团队的资格，没有具体的联系或证据，使人怀疑他们是否有能力执行甚至是计划最初阶段的精简版本。  预算描述得很清楚，但它似乎并没有与路线图充分挂钩，以便为提案提供一个清晰的前进路径，例如需要开发哪些组件，需要确保办公空间和托管之外的哪些资源，以及如何资助和执行某些目标，如社交聚会。  此外，即使是建立一个基本的本地交易所的过程也充满了责任和风险，而在这个提案中没有暗示对这些想法的理解。  除了一个详细的前3-6个月的资金路线图外，看到一个有说服力的以当地埃塞俄比亚货币交易加密货币对的风险分析，以及一个人的ETB可以通过这样一个平台获得的稳定性，将会很有帮助。  如果这个建议被解析为这样一个目标，并可能作为dex提交考虑，这也许是一个值得追求的目标。
f6_assessments.q2: 所提供的路线图是一个跨越约3-4年的雄心勃勃的推力，缺乏评估该时间段内现实的里程碑所需的颗粒度。  仅仅关注发展的前6个月，在建立一个众筹平台的既定目的之前，最好能说明某些指标，以帮助建立对项目的信心：每周或每两周预计加入dex的用户，社交媒体参与度指标，什么是成功启动项目的开发者聚会的指标。  应该还有更多，但这将是一个好的开始。  最后，一个更细化的路线图将提供事件和资产的交付日期，比现有的90-180天的窗口更有分辨率。  我认为一个如此雄心勃勃的项目，在如此规模的情况下，如果能有一个更大的团队，或者在路线图的最初6个月里有一个更小的重点，那将是非常有益的。

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal suggests a novel way of integrating payment systems through COTi to enable crowdfunding opportunities in Africa.  This has the potential to be very useful in countries and areas that don't have strong CEX capabilities to handle local fiat currency exchange.  This proposal is targeting Africa, but that could encompass billions of future people and still has a large scale it could affect.
f6_assessments.q1: This project has developers credentials and GitHub repositories listed as well as a plan for development and implementation included in the proposal. The amount requested is also broken down well to include how the proposed funds would be spent and are reasonable amounts considering the development plans.
f6_assessments.q2: With the roadmap, development and implementation milestones that this proposal has listed as well as how the proposal funds are spent make this proposal very transparent and auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal includes some concepts of payment for crowdsourcing of African tokens; however, there is no explanation of how the COTI tools will facilitate this development.  Furthermore, the proposal implies that some of the funds may be applied to the development of the Ennarea exchange which would not require a crypto payment solution.
f6_assessments.q1: The team's plan is quite well laid out. They document the current state of a demo website of the trading website.  The first goal is the production release of the exchange, targeted for June 2022.  The second goal is the launch of the crowdfunding platform, which presumably is the principal focus of this project; however, the time frame of Jul2022-Jan 2023 raises some questions about the title and focus of the effort.  The project includes goals for the two follow on years.  In particular, the payment services, which is the focus of this challenge, is planned for 2023.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides good details regarding the goals of the project.  Each goal has measurable targets such as 50 thousand active users and $1 million daily transaction volume by June 2022 for the exchange; Crowdfunding the first startup on New Year's Eve, 2023; 1 million individual and business customers by Dec 2024

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal completely misses the objectives of the campaign. The main problem of the campaign, that is how to build a plug-in to integrate ADA Pay seamlessly so small merchants are able to accept ADA payments is never addressed. Because of that metrics and roadmap are not aligned with the challenge goals.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal cannot be considered feasible because the goals are distorted. Even if they succeed with the presented idea, it will not be possible to state that the proposal was successfully implemented because they will not achieve the goals of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: Because there is not a clear understanding of the targeted problem it is not possible to affirm the proposal has a good auditability. The KPIs defined completely miss the direction in which the project must go to fulfill the objectives of the challenge. The proposed solution does not address the problem posed so auditing is virtually meaningless.

f6_assessments.q0: This challenge is to design a plugin that will help merchants accept ada payment in e-commerce platforms such as shopify and woocommerce. The proposer did not address the challenge effectively as its goal is create a crowdfunding plateform. This proposal can have chances in other challenges like DEFI for instance. I suggest to the proposer to find the best challenge for this proposal in order to increase its chances of being funded
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is not the right challenge which makes it really difficult to have confidence in its feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer should chose the right challenge. Defi can be the right challenge for this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
I disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge. In my opinion this proposal is more fit into Cardano (dapps/development/defi) settings. 

The campaign brief " we expect from the teams involved in the challenge to create an innovative plug-in that will be integrated with our current ADA Pay system on the one hand and support all the different e-commerce software mentioned above (Shopify and WooCommerce) on the other." clearly mention the challenge settings is about how we can built a plugin to help spread wide usage of AdaPay solution in ecommerce domain.

This proposal, nevertheless, is very well written, but sadly is just not a fit in my opinion for this challenge settings. I will therefore, ask the proposer to have been talked through some vCAs OR community on telegram to see where this could be the right fit.
f6_assessments.q1:
In my opinion this proposal is not a fit for this category, pasting the same reasoning below.

The campaign brief " we expect from the teams involved in the challenge to create an innovative plug-in that will be integrated with our current ADA Pay system on the one hand and support all the different e-commerce software mentioned above (Shopify and WooCommerce) on the other." clearly mention the challenge settings is about how we can built a plugin to help spread wide usage of AdaPay solution in ecommerce domain.

This proposal, nevertheless, is very well written, but sadly is just not a fit in my opinion for this challenge settings. I will therefore, ask the proposer to have been talked through some vCAs OR community on telegram to see where this could be the right fit

f6_assessments.q0:
This is just an idea not a proposal The idea itself meets the challenge goals  
There is no basis on which to assess this proposal as there is detailed information on how this proposal provides a solution

I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading. I have also been an event organizer in various capacities, both through my company and on a voluntary basis for youth groups and churches.  I also have run a web development company from 1997 and have been the author of many ground breaking projects in web and Flash related projects in my country.I have done live event with guests in studio, discussing various topics on the State Broadcasting Channels for both National and International audiences.


 


I cannot give this anything other than a 1 rating
f6_assessments.q1:
No profiles or experience of team members are given, no budget is given except a single figure of almost 30000, there is no breakdown of costs or anything at all
In a project involving financial services especially crypto banking, I would expect to see a large team of experienced and reputed partners with a vast experience pool behind them. Here there is only one name listed. 

I cannot give this anything other than a 1 rating
f6_assessments.q2: A time table has been given but there is no basis, since no staff is given, whether any of this can be depended on. THerefore I can only give, in my professional opinion a 1 rating

f6_assessments.q0: It's always great to see a proposal come back in another fund. And it's even better to see the upgraded their proposal. Really love the idea but I fail to see the link with the Challenge. I know this proposal has a lot of potentials but no reference to the challenge is provided. This proposal would've been better suited for another challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is very well written for feasibility. We get enough information to see if this project will come to success or not. Regarding the team, I do wonder if the proposer is solo working on this project or not. We only get information about the proposer himself. I would suggest picking up some team members to help with this proposal given the scope of it.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding auditability, we have positive details and some that still need some work. The proposer clearly defines his solution to the problem. He also gives a good breakdown of why he needs funding and where these would go. However, the KPIs given are in my experience a bit exaggerated. How will you be able to reach 100.000 active users in 6months? We get no insight on how you plan on marketing this project, Especially since the proposer is working solo on this.

f6_assessments.q0: Relation to personal qualifications: Since I am actively observing the general crypto space since several years and also the projects in Project Catalyst, I have a certain understanding of what opportunities the sector has to offer and what applications could provide added value to the community. In addition to this I have an understanding of budgeting, both due to my past engagement as a treasurer in a political organisation and my current work as a project engineer, which will give me a good grasp of realistic budgeting of projects. The proposal does not fit into the set out challenge. This indicates that the proposer either has not read the challenge properly or does not fully grasp it. Feedback: I suggest for future proposals, you read up on the topic of the challenge and try to think about how your proposal can adress concrete points of this challenge. In general, the proposal looks more ore less like a copy of the proposal for the exchange with crowdfunding added in at some points, but not really like an own propsal where a real crowdfunding platform is planned. Feedback: Formulate a proposal that really matches the title and problem statement. Also, I'd advise you to find a challenge that matches your proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not provide sufficient information about themselves and does not provide proof of their alleged qualifications other than the pilot of an exchange that has nothing to do with the proposal. Feedback: For future proposals, maybe consider linking some verifiable personal information about yourself. The proposer does not define team members. A budget and an implementation plan is presented, but it is pretty much the same as for the other proposal on exchanges, which indicates this proposal was not really planned yet. No technical background is explained and no risk assesment is done. Feedback: Checkall the requirements for a good proposal. While an idea like this has potential, it needs to be properly planned to be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: No roadmap with milestones or a time horizon for achievement that match with the actual proposal are presented, neither are any metrics, KPIs, or success criteria that relate to the actual proposal defined. Metrics are just copied from the exchange proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: It actually sounds like a really cool project, but it has nothing to do with ADApay and does not belong in this category.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is not related to ADApay. Any version of "success" will not not relate to the challenge goals.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is not related to ADApay. No auditable goals meet the challenge requirements.

f6_assessments.q0: It is not clear what the purpose of this proposal is. It looks more like they are asking for a seed funding of an intent to deploy an exchange that will enable ADA trading in Ethiopia. It is not clear how it relates to the stated intent (Crowdfunding with ADA) nor how it relates to the COTI challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience with developing such exchanges is not clear - although a mockup is presented and the proposer sees themselves as a technology enthusiast. The plan is detailed for one year - but it focuses on the exchange launch and promotion.
f6_assessments.q2: It is not clear how this will be audited - unless the exchange will be up and running by the time the budget is spent. I have nothing to guarantee that this will be accomplished given the information provided.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer seems to describe in their project a centralized exchange for Africa which is completely irrelevant to this challenge. This is why I'll give a score of 1.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer seems to be clear about their project and they provide a video of what seems to be an MVP. They also provide a broad idea about the expertise needed for the project which will mostly start by hiring freelancers. Different milestones are provided yet these milestones seem to be on a macro level since no specific technical information is given.  The proposer also seems to have limited experience in this field.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer presented a roadmap with different milestones a time periods. They also have a clear KPI that one can check to evaluate the development of the project (Users number, cash flow,...). But the proposer seems to not specify details of the problem itself that are relevant to this challenge and how they will solve them.

f6_assessments.q0: Novel idea, but doest address any of the metrics of the challenge. this proposal would have been better suited to other challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has demonstrated his skills to carry out the project, but again it doesn't align with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: Clear implementation plan and timeline, but not enough KPIs for timely auditing of the project.

solution: 由ADA支持的创业公司Luchapad和非洲的众筹门户。
experience: 软件工程师和区块链开发人员开发了一个可生产的加密货币交易平台。
